reviews.review_msg: The most awful experience, extremely arrogant and not helpful at all. Reading over the slides is not teaching. Very disappointed.

He knows the material well, writes excellent exams, and gives has clear expectations for exams/assignments. No surprises, no "gotchas". Also has lectures recorded and gives full lecture notes. No real complaints, definitely one of the top statistics teaching faculty.

One of the best profs I've had at SFU. Brilliant lecture material all on github so it's easy to go through DURING class while he lectures and tweak code yourself if you want. Assignments and tests were straightforward. Honestly guy deserves massive props for the way he ran that course

A very solid choice for this course.  Makes the work fairly straightforward and there are no surprises in terms of his exams and homework assignments.  I actually learned some practical/useful things from the class, which is rare.
He is really disorganized and is always late to lecture. He spends most of lecture sitting down and just repeating what's on the slides but isn't good at making the material accessible.
